alert.note: Alert for Clark; Crawford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 10:02AM CST until February 01 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River. .Lowland flooding is expected to develop along the Wabash from a combination of previous precipitation, snowmelt and additional rainfall on still frozen ground. Expected minor flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop as river ice breaks up with the warmer temperatures and moves downstream. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 01... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Terre Haute. * WHEN...From Friday evening to Thursday, February 01. * IMPACTS...At 19.5 feet, Water begins to rise in the Izaak Walton Lake. Sheet flowing water begins in the wetland project between U.S. 40 and I-70, and during a prolonged flood event project fills about 75 percent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Thursday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 19.4 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday, February 01. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 215 AM EST /115 AM CST/.
